Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Officer Maekawa failed to observe procedural fairness or committed factual errors in denying restoration application
Crimes.Application_Facts: Mr. Zhang applied for restoration of temporary resident status; new evidence was submitted showing eligibility as a bona fide student
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Restoration application denied by Officer Maekawa
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national seeking restoration of temporary resident status
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Officer Maekawa relied on prior decision without providing independent reasons or addressing new evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Breach of procedural fairness, failure to provide adequate reasons, disregard of new evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness requires minimal explanation when rights are affected
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Presence of new evidence supporting bona fide intent
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide reasons or engage with new evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly assessed due to procedural deficiencies
Crimes.Evidence_Used: New documentation showing Mr. Zhang’s continued studies and compliance
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections of IRPA related to restoration of status
Crimes.Application_Basis: Application for restoration under IRPA s. 182(5)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Insufficiently assessed; new evidence not meaningfully considered
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness in administrative decision-making under IRPA
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Decision lacked engagement with newly submitted materials
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Denial of legal status without fair process
Crimes.Cause_Description: Restoration application denied without adequate explanation despite new evidence of eligibility
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: New evidence ignored or not properly evaluated
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions concerning procedural fairness in restoration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to address relevant and material new evidence
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Applicant claimed compliance with conditions prior to overstay
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Inadequate assessment of applicant's credibility and circumstances
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Decision based on prior officer’s findings without independent analysis
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of transparency in rejection of new evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Procedural fairness under Canadian administrative law

Crimes.Violation_Type: Remaining in Canada beyond authorized period
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Officer Maekawa failed to observe procedural fairness or commit factual errors in denying restoration
Crimes.Application_Facts: Mr. Zhang overstayed after study permit extension denial; applied for restoration with new evidence
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Former international student who overstayed due to delayed extension processing
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Officer Maekawa failed to provide sufficient reasons or consider new evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness, inadequate reasoning, failure to assess new evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duty of procedural fairness in immigration decisions
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timeliness of application, reason for delay, bona fides as student
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA and Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of meaningful engagement with applicant's submissions
Crimes.Review_Standard: Standard of reasonableness and procedural fairness
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Enrollment records, academic transcripts, explanation for delay
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 182 – Restoration of temporary resident status
Crimes.Application_Basis: Application filed within 90 days of loss of status
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Set aside decision and remit for reconsideration
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Right to fair process in restoration applications
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No explanation given for rejecting key documents
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of removal and loss of residency rights without fair hearing
Crimes.Cause_Description: Study permit extension denied; restoration refused without proper consideration
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Failure to acknowledge or respond to new evidence
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Reliance on previous officer’s conclusions without fresh assessment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to justify rejection of documentary evidence

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with conditions of temporary resident status
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Officer Maekawa violated procedural fairness in refusing restoration
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: New evidence submitted but not evaluated
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate eligibility for restoration
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness requires reasons and consideration of all evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide reasons or engage with new evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unfair refusal without explanation or proper assessment
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: In favor of applicant due to procedural flaws
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Academic records, explanation for delay, proof of financial support
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Relied on prior officer’s decision without elaboration
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and quashing of decision
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Court Rules
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national out of status seeking restoration
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Loss of status due to late extension application
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness in administrative decisions affecting rights
